snippet.title: Biggest ever BBL announced
snippet.content:
THE Big Bash League will be bigger than ever this summer, with the competition expanded from 32 regular season matches to 40. The fixture lists for both BBL 07 and the Women's Big Bash League were released on Monday, with WBBL 03 kicking off on December 9 and the men's competition beginning on December 19 with a Sydney Smash clash between the Thunder and the Sixers. Both tournaments will finish on February 4.
Cricket: Ben Stokes collects wickets in back-to-back balls against South Africa.
Stokes goes bang bang The expanded season means each BBL 07 side will play 10 games during the regular season, up from the eight they played last summer. Each side will also receive an additional home match. Take a look at the fixtures below. BIG BASH LEAGUE Sydney Thunder v Sydney Sixers, 19 December Brisbane Heat v Melbourne Stars, 20 December Hobart Hurricanes v Melbourne Renegades, 21 December Adelaide Strikers v Sydney Thunder, 22 December Sydney Sixers v Perth Scorchers, 23 December Melbourne Renegades v Brisbane Heat, 23 December Perth Scorchers v Melbourne Stars, 26 December Brisbane Heat v Sydney Thunder, 27 December Sydney Sixers v Adelaide Strikers, 28 December Melbourne Renegades v Perth Scorchers, 29 December Hobart Hurricanes v Sydney Thunder, 30 December Adelaide Strikers v Brisbane Heat, 31 December Sydney Thunder v Hobart Hurricanes, 1 January Perth Scorchers v Sydney Sixers, 1 January Melbourne Stars v Brisbane Heat, 2 January Melbourne Renegades v Sydney Sixers, 3 January Hobart Hurricanes v Adelaide Strikers, 4 January Brisbane Heat v Perth Scorchers, 5 January Melbourne Stars v Melbourne Renegades, 6 January Sydney Thunder v Adelaide Strikers, 7 January Hobart Hurricanes v Sydney Sixers, 8 January Perth Scorchers v Melbourne Renegades, 8 January Adelaide Strikers v Melbourne Stars, 9 January Brisbane Heat v Hobart Hurricanes, 10 January Sydney Thunder v Perth Scorchers, 11 January Melbourne Renegades v Melbourne Stars, 12 January Adelaide Strikers v Perth Scorchers, 13 January Sydney Sixers v Sydney Thunder, 13 January Hobart Hurricanes v Brisbane Heat, 15 January Melbourne Stars v Sydney Sixers, 16 January Adelaide Strikers v Hobart Hurricanes, 17 January Sydney Sixers v Brisbane Heat, 18 January Melbourne Stars v Sydney Thunder, 20 January Perth Scorchers v Hobart Hurricanes, 20 January Melbourne Renegades v Adelaide Strikers, 22 January Sydney Sixers v Melbourne Stars, 23 January Sydney Thunder v Melbourne Renegades, 24 January Perth Scorchers v Adelaide Strikers, 25 January Melbourne Stars v Hobart Hurricanes, 27 January Brisbane Heat v Melbourne Renegades, 27 January Semi-final 1, 1 February Semi-final 2, 2 February Final, 4 February
Cricket: Eagle-eyed Bavuma's brilliance against England to run-out Ali.
